caption.p: Influenza virus infection. Like other forms of respiratory viral infection, influenza may cause a lymphocytic or necrotizing bronchiolitis, in this case associated with mucus stasis in the bronchioles (H&E, 40Ã—). Autopsy examination following fatal influenza viral infection typically shows a necrotizing bronchitis and bronchiolitis with pulmonary edema and diffuse alveolar damage in the background (not shown)
